            <h4 id="-1058033099__tab0" class="dropdown-text">What is the difference between 'Quick Transfer' and 'Pay & transfer'?  </h4>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-1058033099__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_69">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_69" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_65" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">'Quick Transfer' is a feature found in the 'Quick Links' on your account dashboard after logging in to Online Banking. It allows you to transfer money between your own HSBC Hong Kong dollar accounts immediately.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The 'Pay & transfer' tab in the top menu directs you to journeys that allow you to transfer money between both your own and third-party accounts, domestically and internationally, in Hong Kong dollars and other supported foreign currencies. You can also set up an immediate transfer, a future dated payment or a recurring payment.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>

</div>

    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-230942025__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h4 id="-230942025__tab0" class="dropdown-text">What is 'My payee' and how to use it for making transfers? </h4>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-230942025__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_70">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_70" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_66" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The 'My payees' are registered accounts to which you can make transfers without the need to input their details each time. Once you have registered a new payee in your HSBC Online Banking, no further authentication using the Security Device / Mobile Secure Key is required when you make transfers to the account going forward. This is a useful feature if you transfer regularly (for example, paying school fees) to the same third-party account.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Once the account has been registered in "My payees", simply choose the "My payees" option when making your transfer request and select the required account to which you wish to transfer funds. The maximum daily limits for transfers to "My payees" are HKD3,000,000 per account, and by default the payees' maximum daily transfer is HKD50,000. You may change the transfer limit or delete this payee via HSBC Online Banking after the instructions is effective.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>

    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">

            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-1570613794__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_71">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_71" class="cc-column">

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can make Hong Kong dollar or foreign currency transfer to HSBC or non-HSBC accounts, including overseas accounts, by selecting your desired payment journey from the 'Pay & transfer' tab in the top menu. You will need your Security Device / Mobile Security Key to complete this transaction.</p>
</div></div>

        <section id="481069339__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">

<div id="content_main_columnControl_72">

        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_72" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_68" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Go to 'Pay & transfer' from the top menu > 'Settings' > 'Daily payment and transfer limits'.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The new limits will be effective immediately. You will only need your Security Device/Mobile Security Key to increase a payee's transfer limit.</p>
</div></div>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This is an anti-scam alert message and will be shown when the payee's FPS Proxy ID (mobile number/email/FPS identifier) / account number is listed as “High Risk” as per the scam prevention advice provided by the Hong Kong Police Force on Scameter. You are advised to verify the identity of the payee before making transactions. The anti-scam alert is generated based on information collected from scam reports and recorded in the Scameter of the Hong Kong Police Force. Please visit the webpage of Scameter (<a href="https://cyberdefender.hk/en-us/scameter/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">https://cyberdefender.hk/en-us/scameter/</span><span class="visuallyhidden">https://cyberdefender.hk/en-us/scameter/  This link will open in a new window</span></a>) for more details. </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/help/faq/transfers-and-payments/#anti-scam-alert" target="_self">Learn more</a> </p>
</div></div>

    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="1715101368__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="1715101368__tab0" class="dropdown-text">When will the funds of my e-Cheque be deposited? </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="1715101368__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_87">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_82" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If we receive your deposit instruction before the cut-off time, the funds of the e-Cheque will be made available in the next business day* upon successful clearance. If the instruction is received after the cut-off time, the funds will be made available 2 business days* after deposited upon successful clearance.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">* Business day refers to Monday to Friday except public holidays. e-Cheque will be processed and cleared as usual and will not be affected by Typhoon Signal No. 8 or above and/or Black Rainstorm Warning issued by the Hong Kong Observatory, or an “Extreme Conditions“ announced by the HKSAR Government.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>

            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="1003672206__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You cannot print an e-Cheque and deposit it as a paper cheque because e-Cheque is a digitally-signed-document which cannot be verified in a hard copy.<br> </p>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You need to use Adobe Acrobat Reader to open the e-Cheque PDF file. After open it, a message will be displayed to show the e-Cheque has a valid certificate from both the payer and the bank. <br> <br> If the certificate is invalid, please download the latest Adobe Acrobat Reader and load the latest trusted certificate from Adobe server (Adobe Reader -> Edit -> Preferences -> Trust Manager). <br> <br> If the problem still exists, please refer to the drawer of the e-Cheque.<br> </p>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can present HKD/USD/RMB e-Cheque to the banks in Guangdong Province and Shenzhen subject to acceptance of deposit bank. Same as paper cheque, there are some constraints on RMB e-cheque presented in Guangdong Province and Shenzhen. You could find the information in below link or contact the target deposit bank for clarification.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Guangzhou: <a href="https://echeque.gzebasc.cn/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">https://echeque.gzebasc.cn/</span><span class="visuallyhidden">https://echeque.gzebasc.cn/  This link will open in a new window</span></a> <br> Shenzhen: <a href="https://cust.szfesc.cn/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">https://cust.szfesc.cn/</span><span class="visuallyhidden">https://cust.szfesc.cn/  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p>
</div></div>

            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM M-BSCTBL-RW-RBWM" role="region"><div data-accessibility-tick-icon-text="available" data-accessibility-cross-icon-text="not available" id="content_main_basicTable_1" class="table-wrapper flexible-columns
            ">
    
    
        
        <table class="desktop">
            <caption>
                
    
    
    

















                
    
    
    














<div class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL text-container text ">
    
    
        
        Forms
    
</div>


                
            </caption>
            <thead><tr>
 <th scope="col"><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Form name</strong></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Description</p></th>
 <th scope="col"><span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Form download</strong><br> </span></th>
</tr></thead>
            <tbody><tr>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Self-employed Application Form</strong></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Apply to participate in an HSBC MPF scheme.<br> <br> Download <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/mpf_scheme_brochure.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">MPF Scheme Brochure</span><span class="visuallyhidden">MPF Scheme Brochure  This link will open in a new window</span></a><br></p></td>
 <td><span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/in31.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">IN31</span><span class="visuallyhidden">IN31  This link will open in a new window</span></a></span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Self-employed Person Relevant Income Declaration Form</strong></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Declare relevant income for each scheme financial year for MPF purposes.</p></td>
 <td><span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/in24.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">IN24</span><span class="visuallyhidden">IN24  This link will open in a new window</span></a><br> </span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Individual Tax Residency Self-certification Form (CRS-I (HK)–MPF)</strong></p> <p><span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To confirm your personal status under the Common Reporting Standard (CRS).</span><br></p></td>
 <td><span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/inci.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INCI</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INCI  This link will open in a new window</span></a></span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Personal Details Change Form (Fillable format available)</strong></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Notify any change to personal details, including address, contact number, email address and preferred language for correspondence, etc.</p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For any changes not listed on the form, please inform us in writing.</p></td>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(fillable format)</p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/in91.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">IN91</span><span class="visuallyhidden">IN91  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(<a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/in91_sample.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Sample</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Sample  This link will open in a new window</span></a>)</p></td>
</tr>
<tr>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Change of Member Signature Specimen </strong></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To change the signature specimen.</p></td>
 <td><span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/in92.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">IN92</span><span class="visuallyhidden">IN92  This link will open in a new window</span></a><br> </span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>New/Change of Direct Debit Instruction Notification Form</strong></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Direct Debit Authorisation</p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Notify an addition or change to a direct debit authorisation for your MPF scheme or a particular pay centre, and authorise deduction of MPF contributions from your bank account.</p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Paying your contributions through direct debit saves you time in writing and checking the payee and total amount for each payment.</p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note that about 2 weeks' processing time is required to set up a direct debit authorisation for a bank account with HSBC or Hang Seng Bank, or about a month for other bank accounts.</p></td>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/indp.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INDP</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INDP  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/in14.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">IN14</span><span class="visuallyhidden">IN14  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p></td>
</tr>
<tr>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Change of Investment Instruction Form</strong></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Change your investment instruction of your existing investments and/or future contributions and/or accrued benefits transferred from another Registered Scheme. This form is applicable if you want to:</p>
  <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
   <li>Change the investment allocation of your existing investments, future contributions and accrued benefits transferred from another registered scheme. Appropriate units in your account will be redeemed (if applicable) in order to purchase other funds to meet your new investment allocation percentage; or</li>
   <li>Change the investment allocation of your future contributions and accrued benefits transferred from another registered scheme only. The investment allocation of your existing investments will remain unchanged; or</li>
   <li>Change the investment allocation of your existing investments only. The investment allocation of your future contributions and accrued benefits transferred from another registered scheme will remain unchanged; or</li>
   <li>Exit the Default Investment Strategy (DIS). All of your existing investments, future contributions and accrued benefits transferred from another Registered Scheme will invest per the investment allocation immediately before you exit the DIS. To avoid doubt, no subsequent rebalancing or de-risking of the investment allocation will be done with regard to existing investments, future contributions and accrued benefits transferred from another registered scheme.</li>
  </ul></td>
 <td><span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/inbp.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INBP</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INBP  This link will open in a new window</span></a></span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Remittance Statement</strong></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Report relevant income and contributions.</p></td>
 <td><span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/inb4.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INB4</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INB4  This link will open in a new window</span></a><br> </span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Contribution remittance advice</strong></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To provide contribution remittance details (applicable for the remittance of contributions by cheque due to delays in setting up direct debit authorisation, dishonoured direct debit/cheque or insufficient funds in your last contribution)</p></td>
 <td><span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/incp.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INCP</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INCP  This link will open in a new window</span></a></span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Additional Voluntary Contributions Arrangement Form</strong></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Set up or cancel regular voluntary contribution arrangement.</p></td>
 <td><span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/inps.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INPS</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INPS  This link will open in a new window</span></a><br> </span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Scheme Member's Request for Fund Transfer Form (Fillable format available)</strong><br> Transfer of accrued benefits from another MPF scheme to an HSBC MPF scheme, or vice versa.<br></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">It is also applicable for employees who cease employment to transfer their benefits to an individual personal account.</p></td>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/mpf/regulatory-require/inpm/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INPM</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INPM  This link will open in a new window</span></a> (fillable format)</p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(<a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/inpm_sample.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Sample</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Sample  This link will open in a new window</span></a>) </p></td>
</tr>
<tr>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Scheme Member's Request for Account Consolidation Form</strong></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Consolidate multiple personal accounts into one account.</p></td>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="https://www.mpfa.org.hk/en/utinity-bar/useful-tools/forms/mpf-schemes/consolidation-of-personal-accounts" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">MPF(S)-P(C)</span><span class="visuallyhidden">MPF(S)-P(C)  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(Download from MPFA's website)</p></td>
</tr>
<tr>
 <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Customer Information Form – Personal Customer</strong></p> <p><span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Provide accurate and up-to-date information to support a more secure protection arrangement.</span><br></p></td>
 <td><span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/inke.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INKE</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INKE   This link will open in a new window</span></a></span></td>
</tr>
<tr>

(Applicable to employer or member) Request a copy of any previous employer or member statement for up to 7 years prior.<br> The handling charge is HKD50 per scheme financial year for each copy.<br> 2.  (Applicable to employer) Request a Member Contribution History Report.<br> 3.  (Applicable to employer) Request for provision of information of employees’ accrued benefits for the purpose of processing the refund or calculation of long service payment/severance payment paid or payable to the related employee for the purpose of Section 12A of Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance.</p></td>

                    <th scope="row"><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Form name</strong></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Description</p></th>
                    <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>New/Change of Direct Debit Instruction Notification Form</strong></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Direct Debit Authorisation</p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Notify an addition or change to a direct debit authorisation for your MPF scheme or a particular pay centre, and authorise deduction of MPF contributions from your bank account.</p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Paying your contributions through direct debit saves you time in writing and checking the payee and total amount for each payment.</p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note that about 2 weeks' processing time is required to set up a direct debit authorisation for a bank account with HSBC or Hang Seng Bank, or about a month for other bank accounts.</p></td>
                </tr>
            
                <tr>
                    <th scope="row"><span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Form download</strong><br> </span></th>
                    <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/indp.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INDP</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INDP  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/in14.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">IN14</span><span class="visuallyhidden">IN14  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p></td>
                </tr>

            </tr>
        
            
                <tr>
                    <th scope="row"><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Form name</strong></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Description</p></th>
                    <td><p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Change of Investment Instruction Form</strong></p> <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Change your investment instruction of your existing investments and/or future contributions and/or accrued benefits transferred from another Registered Scheme. This form is applicable if you want to:</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>Change the investment allocation of your existing investments, future contributions and accrued benefits transferred from another registered scheme. Appropriate units in your account will be redeemed (if applicable) in order to purchase other funds to meet your new investment allocation percentage; or</li>
 <li>Change the investment allocation of your future contributions and accrued benefits transferred from another registered scheme only. The investment allocation of your existing investments will remain unchanged; or</li>
 <li>Change the investment allocation of your existing investments only. The investment allocation of your future contributions and accrued benefits transferred from another registered scheme will remain unchanged; or</li>
 <li>Exit the Default Investment Strategy (DIS). All of your existing investments, future contributions and accrued benefits transferred from another Registered Scheme will invest per the investment allocation immediately before you exit the DIS. To avoid doubt, no subsequent rebalancing or de-risking of the investment allocation will be done with regard to existing investments, future contributions and accrued benefits transferred from another registered scheme.</li>
</ul></td>
                </tr>

    <div class="anchor" id="physical-security-device"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Physical Security Device
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            





        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_89" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We are no longer issuing physical Security Device (except to customers with accessibility needs). If you are still using a physical Security Device, you may switch to Mobile Security Key via HSBC HK App with a few steps. Refer to our <a href="/ways-to-bank/internet/security-key/#set-up-pin" target="_self">step-by-step guide</a>. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are looking for information on Mobile Security Key, you may read our <a href="/mobile/faq/#msk" target="_self">Mobile Banking FAQ</a>. </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_7" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_87" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="471121852__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="471121852__tab0" class="dropdown-text">What is a Security Device? </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="471121852__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_95">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_95" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_90" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">A Security Device is an electronic device to generate a special, one time Security Code. You must enter the Security Code to access services under the "Security Device Logon Mode", such as securities trading and transfer to non-registered accounts.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Security Device has been selected by HSBC as the technology that best meets our customers' need for flexibility and portability. <a href="#pin1"><u>Please refer to the section New Security Device - Functionality for details</u>.</a></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-IMG-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_image_1" class="smart-image">
        
            
            <figure class="smart-image-figure">

        </div>
        <section id="-476792280__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">

<div id="content_main_columnControl_96">

        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_96" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_92" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The Security Code is a special, one-time password used to access full range of Personal Internet Banking service. The 6-digit password appears on the LCD screen of the Security Device for your input into the screen of Online Banking.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>

            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_97">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_93" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Serial Number is a unique number on the back of the Security Device that is linked to your HSBC Personal Internal Banking profile personally. The number is a 10-digit serial number, identifying your individual Security Device.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">As a result, you can only use this individual Security Device, to access your HSBC Personal Internet Banking services. That means if your family member or friend has another Security Device for their Personal Internet Banking services, you cannot use their device to generate a Security Code for your Personal Internet Banking service.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We no longer issue a physical Security Device for Personal Internet Banking customers (except for those with accessibility needs):</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Effective 1 March 2020 for Personal Internet Banking customers with password setup.</li> 
 <li>Effective 1 April 2020 for all other Personal Internet Banking customers.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Instead, you can replace your physical Security Device with Mobile Security Key. If you are not able to do so and require a physical Security Device, please call Customer Services at</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>HSBC Global Private Banking customers: <a href="tel:+852-2233-3033" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2233 3033</a></li>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_101" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There are two types of Security Code generated by Security Devices with different format, which support different functions in HSBC Personal Internet Banking. Please refer to details below:<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-NTCTBL-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div class="table-wrapper c-999" data-accessibility-tick-icon-text="available" data-accessibility-cross-icon-text="not available" id="content_main_notice_table_10">
     <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><th><strong>Security Code Format</strong></th>
<th><strong>How to generate?</strong></th>
<th><strong>Example of Function</strong></th>
</tr><tr><td>123456</td>
<td>Customers press the Green Button on the device to generate the Security Code</td>
<td>Internet banking Log on and Step Up verification</td>
</tr><tr><td>123 456</td>
<td>Customers input specific information into the device and press  the Yellow Button to generate the Security Code</td>
<td>Third-party account transfer verification</td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_102" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Note:</strong> The 1st and 2nd generation Security Devices are no longer in use. If you are still using them, please consider setting up a Mobile Security Key, which enables you to log on and authenticate transactions more securely and conveniently. Otherwise, please call us to request for a replacement with a PIN-protected Security Device. <a href="#Secure_Device_5">Learn more about our replacement policies</a>.<br> </p>
</div></div>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The following instructions will be effective immediately:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Making transfers to non-registered account</li> 
 <li>Increasing transfer limit of non-registered account</li> 
 <li>Making bill payment to finance / securities / sports and leisure</li> 
 <li>Decreasing transfer limits</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For the following instructions, submission before 9pm from Mon to Fri or 6pm on Sat will be effective on next working day:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Setting up registered transfer account and defining transfer limit</li> 
 <li>Increasing transfer limit of registered account</li> 
</ul>

        </div>
        <section id="-337602515__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_104" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The battery in the Security Device can last for three to five years, depending on how frequently you use it. When the battery of your Security Device is running</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">low, you’ll receive a ‘BATT’ message as a prompt. Please note that we no longer issue a physical Security Device for Personal Internet Banking customers</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(except for those with accessibility needs):</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Effective 1 March 2020 for Personal Internet Banking customers with password setup.</li> 
 <li>Effective 1 April 2020 for all other Personal Internet Banking customers.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Instead, you can replace your physical Security Device with Mobile Security Key. For more details, please refer to our trouble shooting guide at www.personal.hsbc.com.hk/securitydevice.</p>
</div></div>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The HSBC Security Device is unique and with an enhanced level of security with a PIN lock which minimizes the chance of unauthorized use and protects you against possible online threats. For added security, you will have to set a PIN during activation and this PIN will be required to unlock your device before use. You MUST set up the PIN before using the Security Device.<br> </p>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_109" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To set up the PIN for the new Security Device, please follow the steps below for the first time:</p>
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL">
 <li>Hold the bottom right green button for 2 seconds to turn on the Device</li>
 <li>Enter a 4-6 digits<sup>*</sup> new PIN using the keypad</li>
 <li>Press the bottom left yellow button to complete the first PIN entry</li>
 <li>Confirm the new PIN by re-entering it</li>
 <li>"NEW PIN CONF" will be displayed for 2 seconds if the PIN is successfully inputted. "HSBC" will be displayed afterwards.</li>
</ol>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><sup>*</sup>For enhanced security, please enter a 6-digit PIN.</p>
</div></div>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To change your PIN for the Security Device:<br> 1. After your device is turned on and unlocked (you see the Welcome screen), press and hold the button "8" for 2 seconds to activate the change PIN function.<br> 2. "New PIN CONF" will display for 2 seconds if the PIN is successfully set up. "HSBC" will be displayed afterwards.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><br> <sup>*</sup>For enhanced security, please enter a 6-digit PIN.</p>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Upon receipt of the new Security Device, you are required to set up your PIN and activate it immediately or <strong>within 30 days</strong> from the issue date of the letter enclosed with your new Security Device. Otherwise, you will not be able to log on to HSBC Online Banking<br> </p>

        <section id="-2038866012__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_117" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To set up the PIN for the new Security Device, please follow the steps below for the first time:<br> 1. Hold the bottom right green button for 2 seconds to turn on the Device<br> 2. Enter a 4-6 digits<sup>*</sup>new PIN using the keypad<br> 3. Press the bottom left yellow button to complete the first PIN entry<br> 4. Confirm the new PIN by re-entering it<br> "NEW PIN CONF" will be displayed for 2 seconds if the PIN is successfully inputted. "HSBC" will be displayed afterwards.<br> <br> <sup>*</sup>For enhanced security, please enter a 6-digit PIN.<br></p>

        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-283072903__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h4 id="-283072903__tab0" class="dropdown-text">How can I activate a new Security Device? </h4>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-283072903__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_122">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_125" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_118" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">After setting up the PIN for your Security Device, please follow the steps below for activation:<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>For first time application of Security Device:</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please follow the steps below to activate the new Security Device:</p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Log on to HSBC Online Banking.</li> 
 <li>You will be prompted a page which asks you to activate your Security Device.</li> 
 <li>Follow the steps shown on the screen for activation.</li> 
</ol> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><br> To complete the activation process, you will need to enter your registered mobile phone number, Serial Number and Security Code from the Security Device, and the one-time activation code which will be sent to your registered mobile phone via SMS.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please make sure that your mobile device is turned on and have turned off SMS forwarding function during the activation process if you have subscribed to such service.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Other channels to activate the Security Device:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Phone banking: Call the respective hotline and activate your new Security Device instantly （phone banking Service PIN verification required）. Please click <a href="https://www.hsbc.com.hk/personal/ways-to-bank/phone-banking.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">here</span><span class="visuallyhidden">here  This link will open in a new window</span></a> for phone banking and PIN set up details.</li> 
 <li>Paper form: Complete the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/ways-to-bank/internet/maintenance-cancellation-form.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">'HSBC Personal Internet Banking Maintenance / Cancellation Request Form' [PDF].</span><span class="visuallyhidden">'HSBC Personal Internet Banking Maintenance / Cancellation Request Form' [PDF].  This link will open in a new window</span></a> and return it to us for processing. Your request will normally be processed within 3 working days (excluding Saturday, Sunday and public holiday) upon receipt of your form.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><br> <strong>For replacement of Security Device:</strong><br> Please follow the steps below to activate the new Security Device:<br> </p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Log on to HSBC Online Banking with your existing Security Device;</li> 
 <li>You will be prompted to click on the activation link;</li> 
 <li>Click the activation link and follow the steps shown on the screen.</li> 
</ol> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><br> You will need to enter the serial number and security code from your <strong>new</strong> Security Device, and the security code from your <strong>existing Security Device</strong> to complete the activation process.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Other channels to activate the Security Device:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Phone banking: Call the respective hotline and activate your new Security Device instantly （Phone banking PIN verification required）. Please click <a href="https://www.hsbc.com.hk/personal/ways-to-bank/phone-banking.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">here</span><span class="visuallyhidden">here  This link will open in a new window</span></a> for phone banking Service and PIN set up details.</li> 
 <li>Paper Form: Complete the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/ways-to-bank/internet/maintenance-cancellation-form.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">'HSBC Personal Internet Banking Maintenance / Cancellation Request Form' [PDF]</span><span class="visuallyhidden">'HSBC Personal Internet Banking Maintenance / Cancellation Request Form' [PDF]  This link will open in a new window</span></a> and return it to us for processing. Your request will normally be processed within 3 working days （excluding Saturday, Sunday and public holiday） upon receipt of your form.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please follow the following steps to turn on your new Security Device:<br> </p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Press the green button on the bottom right of the device, and hold for 2 seconds.</li> 
 <li>When the screen prompt for a "PIN", enter your 4-6 digits self-defined pre-set PIN number using the keypad.</li> 
 <li>Once the device is unlocked, "HSBC" will appear on the screen display and it is ready for use.</li>

            <h3 id="-890752333__tab0" class="dropdown-text">How does inputting customer specific information into the Security Device increase the security level in online banking? </h3>

        <section id="-890752333__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">

<div id="content_main_columnControl_125">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_120" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The new device requires customer to input information specific to the transaction (e.g. account number) into the device to generate a Security Code. With this transaction signing function, the transfer will only be made to the account specified by the customer.<br>
</p>

    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="617392742__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="617392742__tab0" class="dropdown-text">When do I need to input customer specific information into the Security Device? </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="617392742__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_126">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_130" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_121" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Customer specific information is needed to be input into the Security Device to verify your instruction. You need to input customer specific information into the Security Device when you are doing the following transactions:<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Making transfer to non-registered payee with amount higher than small-value payment limit<br> </li> 
 <li>Setting up standing instruction for non-registered payee<br> </li> 
 <li>Making bill payment to high risk merchants i.e. Finance / Securities / Sports & Leisure</li> 
 <li>Adding payee as registered payee<br> </li> 
 <li>Defining or Increasing Online transfer limit</li> 
 <li>Setting up Autopay</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can click on the region / country selection on the top right corner on Banking 2.0 page > add / remove a country or region to access the Global View journey. After selecting the country / territory you want to link up with, you are redirected to the online banking logon page of destination country / territory.     <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can add accounts of other countries or regions via 'Global View' on HSBC Online Banking.</p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Log on to HSBC Online Banking and select ‘Country/region’ on top right corner of menu.</li> 
 <li>Click ‘Add/remove a country or region’ to access ‘Global View’ menu.</li> 
 <li>Select the country or territory you want to add and link to your Global Account.</li> 
 <li>Click ‘Link a country/territory’ to confirm.</li> 
</ol>
</div></div>
